modName: Permanent Priority and Affinity for Skyrim
summary: Permanent Priority & Affinity for Skyrim on Dual/Quad core CPU\'s
descriptionHtml:
Permanent Priority & Affinity for Skyrim (tesv.exe) on Dual/Quad core CPU\'s

Here\'s a simple tip to permanently assign priority & affinity to the skyrim executable.

(1) create a new text file in your main game folder (where tesv.exe is installed)

(2) name it what you want but change the extention to BAT (example: tesv.bat)

(3) open the bat file with any text editor, such as notepad

(4) add the following line
@start /high /affinity X TESV.exe

(5)  X represents the core(s) you would like to assign
use the chart below to determine specific core(s)

1 = core 0
2 = core 1
3 = cores 0 and 1
4 = core 2
5 = cores 0 and 2
6 = cores 1 and 2
7 = cores 0, 1, and 2
8 = core 3
9 = cores 0 and 3
D = cores 0, 2, and 3
F = cores 0, 1, 2, and 3

(6) /high represents the CPU priority
use the chart below to assign a specific priority (default = normal, recommended = high)

/realtime
/high
/abovenormal
/normal
/belownormal
/low

(7) save the BAT file

(8) create a shortcut of the BAT file (right click > send to > Desktop)

(9) now you can change the icon and place the shortcut where-ever you want

I have tested this and it does work (open task manager > checked TESV.EXE > priority = HIGH, affinity = 1)

My main concern is namely the \"Load Loose Files\" checkbox in SkyrimLauncher... by launching with the BAT file
I\'m not sure if the \"Loose\" file assignment with be activated.

Once I find out I will update or remove this tip.
